experiences.description:
The Convenience store located in downtown Toronto is one of the leading stores which stocks a wide range of everyday items. We manage a wide range of customers coming from different countries and races. Our focus is to provide positive customer experience by excellent communication and client service.
•	Greeting customers with a smile and making guest feel welcomed and attended.
•	Communicating with clients to understand their requirements and providing directions and solutions.
•	Managing the cash register, billing items, collecting payment, and maintaining receipt of transactions.
•	Counting the contents of cash register at the end of each shift to make sure the accounts tally.
•	Managing online orders, preparing, and working with customers to resolve queries and disputes.

experiences.title: Senior Financial Analyst
experiences.description:
Asset Management - Institutional Client Reporting

The GSAM Client Reporting team manages the client reporting deliverables for all institutional clients globally. In addition, we manage institutional portal client setup, distribution of private placement memoranda, client contacts maintenance, and provide assistance on a number of other client relationship functions, Act as a client reporting specialist within the Bangalore Client Reporting team, partnering closely with Client Relationship Managers and product teams to fulfill regularly scheduled institutional client reporting deliverables. 

The team is responsible for the following functions:
·         Checkout of Standard reports
·         Liasoning with upstream teams for ensuring data accuracy
·         Metrics reporting to management on a daily basis.
·         Preparation & delivery of Custom Reports for institutional clients
·         Co-ordination of regulatory reports for GSAM
·         Manage changes for client statement disclosures and footnotes
·         Access provisioning to GSAM.com

experiences.title: Audit Associate
experiences.description:
Auditing for US investment Management firms.

Here the team helps the US KPMG audit team to complete their audit by performing the Substantive Procedures and other control test works. We work for the US audit team that handles Investment management clients. I have received a Rising star award within the first six months in the firm. I also, have received various good feedback from US audit teams and also client service excellence awards. 

The team's responsibilities include:
* Handling a specific client being dedicated team members from off-shore to help and work along to complete the entire audit of the assigned client.
* Vouching and ensuring the reasonableness of various items like Cash & cash equivalents, Purchase and Sales, Portfolio Holdings by checking the audit evidence and supporting documents.
* Analyzing the unrecorded liabilities, given by the ADPT (Audit Difference Posting Threshold) matching with open trade report.
* Mapping trial balance to the Balance sheet and Profit & Loss Statements.
* Verifying the mathematical accuracy of the Unaudited Financial Statements and Schedule of Investments of different Investment clients.
* Testing of the Partners capital for investment companies by recalculating the management fee and performance allocations.
* Processing all the procedures with a high accuracy percentage and within the agreed timeline. Also, working as a team with US Engagement Teams in case of any clarifications, updates, or queries.

experiences.title: Senior Financial Analyst
experiences.description:
•Guided Finance Leads in preparing comprehensive external audit documentation, leading to a 20% reduction in audit adjustments and ensuring all corporate compliance requirements were met.
• Assumed interim Finance Manager role, overseeing quarterly budgeting practices for our latest acquired business unit, which resulted in a 15% improvement in budget accuracy and alignment with corporate guidelines.
• Conducted internal audits across five business units at Vencora, ensuring appropriate revenue recognition and accurate reconciliations, ultimately reducing financial discrepancies by 25%.
• Led review and consolidation of month-end and quarter-end deliverables from Finance Leads across multiple VBUs globally, ensuring accuracy and timeliness, resulting in a 20% reduction in closing cycle time.
• Advised and supported VBU Finance teams on technical IFRS standards, particularly Revenue Recognition and Lease Accounting, resulting in a 15% improvement in compliance and accuracy of financial reporting.
• Conducted comprehensive training sessions for VBU Finance teams on financial systems (Great Plains, BPC) and shared Corporate Reporting best practices, leading to a 30% increase in system proficiency and alignment with global reporting standards.
• Reviewed and provided feedback on $1M+ revenue contracts to ensure IFRS compliance with VBU revenue recognition policies, reducing financial risk and improving recognition accuracy by 25%.

experiences.title: Financial Analyst
experiences.description:
• Enhanced financial reporting for Consumer and Outdoor SBUs by developing and presenting Financial Scorecards to Executive, Sales, and Marketing Teams, leading to improved decision-making accuracy and a 20% reduction in reporting turnaround time.
• Streamlined monthly and quarterly forecasting processes for Floorcare, Consumer, and Outdoor Business Units, identifying variances from Budget/Prior Forecast and delivering actionable recommendations that contributed to a 15% increase in forecast accuracy.
• Led the annual budgeting process for Floorcare, Consumer, and Outdoor, collaborating with SBU teams to assess Gross Margin and Standard Margin performance, resulting in a 10% improvement in budget adherence and alignment with corporate financial goals.
• Implemented monthly management estimate accruals for SG&A expenses, ensuring accuracy and compliance with financial reporting standards, reducing accrual errors by 25%.
• Provided detailed variance analysis on key P&L items, enabling management to make informed decisions and achieve a 12% reduction in controllable expenses.

•Effectively communicated with hundreds of licensed cemetery operators via phone; to educate, instruct and ensure proper reporting standards for each operator's Annual Licensure Report

experiences.title: Senior Finance Lead - Project Management Specialist
experiences.description:
Working with highly challenging environment driving consistency. Responsible for building project pricing models, project financial analysis, reconciliations and scenario analyses in relation to budgets and forecasts with an agenda driven on improving project margins. Interacting regularly with internal business partners to perform risk evaluation, project planning, preparation of budgets, examining forecasts, monitoring and identifying budget variances & communicating impact on financial results on their cost centers. 

• Oversee AR team and entire process of revenue recognition , ME Reporting, Financial Preparations
• Project Pricing, FTE Analysis, Project creation, Project budgeting, Forecasting, Project Financial reporting
• Expense Review, Invoicing, ETC & EAC reporting, EVM analysis, Risk Analysis Review - Project Financial statements, Revenue analysis, Complex scenario analysis, Creation WBS, CBS etc.
• Planning/scheduling, cost engineering, cost estimating and cost analysis/control activities for a major project, schedule progress reports, trending charts and schedule analysis, Sub contractor management
• SME for development of governance, internal controls, process , and training materials, Lead projects from requirements definition through deployment, identifying schedules, scopes, budget estimations, and implementation plans, including risk mitigation
• Assist with update to projections on cash flows, staffing plans and contingency usage & support the change control process, establishing the necessary forms, logs and expediting methods
• Milestone invoicing monthly/quarterly basis , recognize revenue and perform Project close out activities
• Built Financial Performance Dashboard for leadership & Corporate reporting 
• Successful Project Completion – GE Aerospace Separation’22

experiences.title: Bilingual Finance Specialist
experiences.description:
As an Accounting & Finance Analyst, I monitored different indicators such as profitability, liquidity, and solvency, and research financial information which further is made available to executives to make the best business decisions. My Essential responsibilities included: gathering and analyzing financial data, making financial predictions, finding ways to improve financial performance, monitoring financial trends, and influencing strategic decisions making. Also, performing full cycle accounting duties, month end closure, account reconciliations, passing journal entries and financial reporting.

Primary Duties:
	Preparation of annual/operational budget, financial reports and other ad hoc reporting for management
	Reviewed Financial statements, analyze sales revenue, costs, expenses for business units
	Partnered with top management in building and implementing cost and inventory control systems for better reporting strategy, including monthly financial reporting
	Cost Accounting, KPI Analysis for various product lines and business unit reporting
	Monitored cost control activities and Product cycle progress
	Calculating product cost and negotiating price with vendors and subcontractors
	Supported external auditors with the necessary information needed in the timely management of preliminary and year-end audit processes.

Monitored and analyzed financial, statistical and operational data trend Analyzes and solved problems by completing tasks including modeling, reconciliations and reporting conducted analysis on billed and unbilled receivables performing various functions including budgeting, budget forecasts, and assisting Project Manger in developing monthly in developing reviewing and compiling all financial information, includes Labor hours, materials, other direct costs and travel applicable to the program examining budget estimates for completeness, accuracy and conformance with procedures. Master validation against forecast, ensuring that invoice rate, hours and projects worth over $2M+  monthly basis.

Primary Duties:
 Prepared budgets and forecasts to project and track financial metrics such as revenue, expense
 Primarily involved in handing large client projects with analysis on financial status and outlook 
 Managing revenue recognition, completion estimates, write-offs and margins
 Engaging with project teams and clients to identify and resolve any financial issues
 Proficient in project management, financial software tools MSWord, Excel and Oracle
 Project Accounting and month end closing support in SAP and other systems
 Preparation of Monthly and Annual consolidated financials
 Developed work breakdown structures for all assigned programs to the fourth level of indenture to include cost, resources
 Support on preparation of Quarterly Business Reviews, Rolling Forecasts, anticipate future financial performance and provide analytical advise to business partners

•	Complete daily banking reporting and cash forecasting (Cash management, Borrowing Base and 
        Covenant preparation and submissions).
•	Analyze pricing and product line profitability (Margins analysis, strategy and financial modelling).
•	Full cycle accounting. Rebate accounting.  Payroll accounting.  A/P and A/R functions. F/X accounting.  Manage fixed assets/depreciation and prepaid expense amortization schedules. Process financial entries to ensure proper recording of all business transactions.  Ensure the ERP system is up to date with accurate inventory and financial data (Data management).
•      Create monthly Commissions and Sales reports and submit to senior leaders and sales reps.
•	Conduct monthly GL account analysis and reconciliations.  P&L analysis.
•	Tax Compliance - Corporate. Prepare monthly/quarterly filing of government returns (i.e- HST, QST)
•	Assist with the preparation of the annual audit schedules.
•	Working Capital and Inventory level analysis.
•	Financial modelling, Weekly Operational KPI reporting (Sales, Inventory, Customer acquisitions)

ERP Platform: Oracle NetSuite

experiences.title: Cost Accountant
experiences.description:
• Report costs of day-to-day manufacturing operations/food production (i.e- cost of ingredients, packaging, labour, fixed and variable overhead).
• Generate and submit various reports to the CFO for review and provide analysis on a daily basis.
• Responsible for allocating cost to cost objects related to food production.
• Responsible for inventory control/management and valuation; internal controls compliance; general ledger analysis and reconciliation; accruals; accounts payable; sales reporting and gross margins analysis for all product lines; fixed asset reporting; foreign exchange accounting; working capital analysis; month/year end reporting.
• Prepare budgets, forecasts, and monitor expenditures.
• Determine standard costs and investigate variances with actual costs vs standard costs.
• Coordinate with cross-functional department leaders (operations, purchasing/procurement) in analyzing data, and formulate strategies, i.e - demand forecasting, inventory level mngt.
• Other duties and ad hoc analysis as required.

ERP Platform: Sage 100

experiences.title: Financial Analyst, Finance and Accounting (FP&A) | Supply Chain
experiences.description:
•	Prepare monthly warehouse and logistic accruals
•	Month-end analysis, reporting and journal entry preparation
•	Inter-company profit and excess inventory analysis
•	Reconcile  general ledger inventory to sub ledger at period end
•	Process and monitor capital expenditures
•	Prepare and monitor monthly warehouse key performance indicators
•	Participate in annual budgets
•	Prepare ad hoc analysis
•	Process warehouse and logistic invoices
•	Exposure to Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems
•	Work closely with an experienced management team and cross-functional departments
•	Work with Accounts Payable on monthly accruals to ensure warehouse/transportation expense 
        accuracy.  Review / code accounts payable transactions based on invoices and other approved 
        documents presented in workflow and distribute expenses to the general ledger.

ERP Platform: Microsoft Dynamics GP
